New Records: Suryakumar Yadav hit his second half-century of the tournament, scoring 53 off 28 balls.
Key Match Events: India defeated Afghanistan by 47 runs in the first Super 8 match in the ongoing ICC Men's T20 World Cup at the Kensington Oval in Barbados on 20 June.
Jasprit Bumrah and Arshdeep Singh picked three wickets each for India.
Kuldeep Yadav took two wickets, while Axar Patel and Ravindra Jadeja clinched one wicket each.
Suryakumar Yadav received the player of the match award for his superb innings.
For Afghanistan, Azmatullah Omarzai scored 26 runs, while no other batter could cross 20 runs.
Rashid Khan and Fazalhaq Farooqi took three wickets each for Afghanistan.
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma decided to bat first after winning the toss.
Rashid Khan mentioned that Afghanistan would have liked to bat first and emphasized playing their natural game.
Post-Match Reflections: India maintained their record of remaining unbeaten against Afghanistan in T20 World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Kensington Oval in Barbados.
India scored 181/8 in 20 overs, setting a target of 182 runs for Afghanistan.
India are undefeated in the tournament till now, while Afghanistan have won three out of four Group matches.
In T20Is, India have beaten Afghanistan 7 times in 8 meetings without facing a defeat, while one match was called off.
In T20 World Cups, India have a 3-0 record against Afghanistan.
